com.att.aro.pcap
Class Packet

java.lang.Object
  com.att.aro.pcap.Packet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
IPPacket
public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An adapter class for packet data.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Packet

protected Packet(long seconds,
                 long microSeconds,
                 int len,
                 int datalinkHdrLen,
                 byte[] data)
Initializes a new instance of the Packet class, using the specified parameters.

Parameters:
datalinkHdrLen - The datalink for the packet.
seconds - The number of seconds for the packet.
microSeconds - The number of microseconds for the packet.
len - The length of the packet (in bytes) including both the header and the data.
data - An array of bytes that is the data portion of the packet.
Method Detail

createPacketFromPcap

public static Packet createPacketFromPcap(int datalink,
                                          long seconds,
                                          long microSeconds,
                                          int len,
                                          byte[] data)
Returns a new instance of the Packet class, using a datalink to a Pcap file and the specified parameters to initialize the class members.

Parameters:
datalink - The datalink to a Pcap file.
seconds - The number of seconds for the packet.
microSeconds - The number of microseconds for the packet.
len - The length of the packet (in bytes) including both the header and the data.
data - An array of bytes that is the data portion of the packet.
Returns:
The newly created packet.

createPacketFromNetmon

public static Packet createPacketFromNetmon(int datalink,
                                            long seconds,
                                            long microSeconds,
                                            int len,
                                            byte[] data)
Returns a new instance of the Packet class, using a datalink to the Microsoft Network Monitor and the specified parameters to initialize the class members.

Parameters:
datalink - The datalink to the Microsoft Network Monitor.
seconds - The number of seconds for the packet.
microSeconds - The number of microseconds for the packet.
len - The length of the packet (in bytes) including both the header and the data.
data - An array of bytes that is the data portion of the packet.
Returns:
The newly created packet.

createPacket

public static Packet createPacket(short network,
                                  long seconds,
                                  long microSeconds,
                                  int len,
                                  int datalinkHdrLen,
                                  byte[] data)
Returns a new instance of the Packet class, using the specified parameters to initialize the class members.

Parameters:
network - The datalink to the network.
seconds - The number of seconds for the packet.
microSeconds - The number of microseconds for the packet.
len - The length of the data portion of the packet (in bytes).
datalinkHdrLen - The length of the header portion of the packet (in bytes).
data - An array of bytes that is the data portion of the packet.
Returns:
The newly created packet.

getData

public byte[] getData()
Gets the data portion of the packet.

Returns:
The packet data.

getSeconds

public long getSeconds()
Gets the number of seconds.

Returns:
A long that is tThe number of seconds.

getMicroSeconds

public long getMicroSeconds()
Gets the number of microseconds.

Returns:
A long that is the number of microseconds.

getTimeStamp

public double getTimeStamp()
Calculates and returns the timestamp value.

Returns:
A double that is the timestamp value.

getLen

public int getLen()
Gets the length of the packet (in bytes) including both the header and the data.

Returns:
An int that is the length of the packet (in bytes).

getPayloadLen

public int getPayloadLen()
Returns the length of the data portion of the packet. Subclasses should override this method to identify their specific payload.

Returns:
The payload length.

getDataOffset

public int getDataOffset()
Returns the offset into the data array where the payload of the packet starts. Subclasses should override this to give proper data offset excluding enclosed headers.

Returns:
The offset within the data array of the packet data, excluding the header information.

getDatalinkHeaderSize

public final int getDatalinkHeaderSize()
Returns the size of the datalink header on the packet.

Returns:
The size of the datalink header for the packet.
